original: @161b # // rgya gar skad du /
analyzed: @161b # // rgya gar skad du /
translated: In Sanskrit:

original: by'a ka ra na lingg'a ba t'a ra na n'a ma /
analyzed: by'a ka ra na lingg'a ba t'a ra na n'a ma /
translated: Vyākaraṇalinga-avatāra-nāma

original: bod skad du /
analyzed: bod skad du /
translated: In Tibetan:

original: lung du ston pa rtags kyi 'jug pa zhes bya ba /
analyzed: lung du ston pa rtags kyi 'jug pa zhes bya ba /
translated: The Entry into the Signs of the Explanatory [Science]

original: by'a ka ra na'i dbang phyug la phyag 'tshal lo //
analyzed: by'a ka ra na'i dbang phyug la phyag 'tshal lo //
translated: Homage to the Lord of Vyākaraṇa!

original: smra ba'i skyes mchog smra ba'i rgyal //
analyzed: smra ba'i skyes mchog smra ba'i rgyal //
translated: Supreme speaker, king of speakers,

original: thams cad mkhyen la phyag 'tshal lo //
analyzed: thams cad mkhyen la phyag 'tshal lo //
translated: Homage to the Omniscient One!

original: pho yi yi ge 'ba' zhig la //
analyzed: pho yi yi ge 'ba' zhig la //
translated: In the male letters alone,

original: sde ba phyed dang brgyad gnas pa'ang //
analyzed: sde ba phyed dang brgyad gnas pa'ang //
translated: The eighteen classes reside.

original: sde tshan lnga ru dril byas la //
analyzed: sde tshan lnga ru dril byas la //
translated: Those are gathered into five groups,

original: yi ge sum cu tham pa la //
analyzed: yi ge sum cu tham pa la //
translated: In the thirty letters.

original: pho dang ma ning mo dang ni //
analyzed: pho dang ma ning mo dang ni //
translated: Male, neuter, female,

original: shin tu mo dang bzhi bzhi ru ;
analyzed: shin tu mo dang bzhi bzhi ru ;
translated: And very female, in groups of four,

original: / sde pa bzhi pa yan chad dbye //
analyzed: / sde pa bzhi pa yan chad dbye //
translated: The fourth class is divided further.

original: lhag ma bcu bzhi gnas pa la //
analyzed: lhag ma bcu bzhi gnas pa la //
translated: The remaining fourteen reside

original: tsa sogs gsum ni ca sogs sbyar //
analyzed: tsa sogs gsum ni ca sogs sbyar //
translated: In the three beginning with ca, applied to those beginning with cha,

original: wa ni ba dang sbyar bar bya //
analyzed: wa ni ba dang sbyar bar bya //
translated: And va is applied to ba.

original: lhag ma drug ni mo ru sbyar //
analyzed: lhag ma drug ni mo ru sbyar //
translated: The remaining six are applied to female.

original: ra la ha ni mo gsham ste //
analyzed: ra la ha ni mo gsham ste //
translated: Ra and la are barren,

original: ma ning mtshan med ces kyang bya //
analyzed: ma ning mtshan med ces kyang bya //
translated: Also called neuter and signless.

original: mo yi yi ge'i nang nas ni //
analyzed: mo yi yi ge'i nang nas ni //
translated: From among the female letters,

original: 'jug pa'i yi ge bcu dbyung bya //
analyzed: 'jug pa'i yi ge bcu dbyung bya //
translated: The ten vowels are to be inserted.

original: 'jug pa bcu yi nang nas ni //
analyzed: 'jug pa bcu yi nang nas ni //
translated: From among the ten vowels,

original: sngon 'jug yi ge lnga dbyung bya //
analyzed: sngon 'jug yi ge lnga dbyung bya //
translated: the five prefixes are to be inserted.

original: sngon 'jug yi ge lnga po la //🔽pho dang ma ning mo dang ni //
analyzed: sngon 'jug yi ge lnga po la // pho dang ma ning mo dang ni //
translated: The five prefixes🔽are divided into four:

original: shin tu mo dang bzhi ru dbye //
analyzed: shin tu mo dang bzhi ru dbye //
translated: male, neuter, female, and superfemale.

original: de dag re re'ang bzhi byed de //
analyzed: de dag re re'ang bzhi byed de //
translated: Each of them has four functions:

original: gang la 'jug byed gang gis byed //
analyzed: gang la 'jug byed gang gis byed //
translated: what is inserted, what inserts,

original: ji ltar 'jug byed ci phyir byed //
analyzed: ji ltar 'jug byed ci phyir byed //
translated: how it is inserted, and why it is inserted.

original: gang la 'jug par byed ce na //
analyzed: gang la 'jug par byed ce na //
translated: What is inserted?

original: pho ni pho dang mo la @162a * //
analyzed: pho ni pho dang mo la @162a * //
translated: The male is inserted into male and female;

original: 'jug / mo ni mo dang ma ning la //
analyzed: 'jug / mo ni mo dang ma ning la //
translated: the female is inserted into female and neuter;

original: ma ning yang ni pho mo la'o //
analyzed: ma ning yang ni pho mo la'o //
translated: the neuter is inserted into male and female.🔽The superfemale is inserted into neuter,

original: shin tu mo ni ma ning dang // mo dang shin tu mo nyid la'o //
analyzed: shin tu mo ni ma ning dang // mo dang shin tu mo nyid la'o //
translated: female, and superfemale.

original: mi 'jug pa ni 'di lta ste //
analyzed: mi 'jug pa ni 'di lta ste //
translated: The noninsertions are as follows:🔽The male is not inserted into the neuter;

original: pho ni ma ning la mi 'jug / mo ni pho la 'jug pa min //
analyzed: pho ni ma ning la mi 'jug / mo ni pho la 'jug pa min //
translated: the female is not inserted into the male.🔽The neuter is not inserted into itself;

original: ma ning rang la rang mi 'jug / rang gi sde dang phrad pa na //🔽pho yang mo la 'jug mi 'gyur //
analyzed: ma ning rang la rang mi 'jug / rang gi sde dang phrad pa na // pho yang mo la 'jug mi 'gyur //
translated: when it meets its own class,🔽the male is not inserted into the female;

original: ma ning mo yang de bzhin no //
analyzed: ma ning mo yang de bzhin no //
translated: the neuter is not inserted into the female.

original: ji ltar 'jug par byed ce na //
analyzed: ji ltar 'jug par byed ce na //
translated: How does one engage?🔽The male engages in a forceful manner,

original: pho ni drag po'i tshul gyis 'jug / ma ning ran par 'jug pa yin //
analyzed: pho ni drag po'i tshul gyis 'jug / ma ning ran par 'jug pa yin //
translated: the neuter engages in a moderate manner.🔽The female engages in a weak manner,

original: mo ni zhan pa'i tshul gyis 'jug / shin tu mo ni mnyam pas so //
analyzed: mo ni zhan pa'i tshul gyis 'jug / shin tu mo ni mnyam pas so //
translated: the very female engages in an equal manner.

original: ci phyir 'jug par byed ce na //
analyzed: ci phyir 'jug par byed ce na //
translated: Why does one engage?

original: pho ni 'das dang gzhan bsgrub phyir //
analyzed: pho ni 'das dang gzhan bsgrub phyir //
translated: The male engages for the sake of the past and the other.

original: ma ning gnyis ka da ltar ched //
analyzed: ma ning gnyis ka da ltar ched //
translated: The neuter engages for the sake of both and the present.

original: mo ni bdag dang ma 'ongs phyir //
analyzed: mo ni bdag dang ma 'ongs phyir //
translated: The female engages for the sake of the self and the future.

original: shin tu mo ni mnyam phyir ro //
analyzed: shin tu mo ni mnyam phyir ro //
translated: The very female engages for the sake of equality.

original: rjes 'jug yi ge bcu po la //
analyzed: rjes 'jug yi ge bcu po la //
translated: The ten following letters

original: pho mo ma ning gsum du dbye //
analyzed: pho mo ma ning gsum du dbye //
translated: are divided into three: male, female, and neuter.

original: pho la skyes bu rab 'bring gsum //
analyzed: pho la skyes bu rab 'bring gsum //
translated: The male has three: the best, the medium, and the inferior.

original: mo la mo dang shin tu mo //
analyzed: mo la mo dang shin tu mo //
translated: The female has the female and the very female.

original: ma ning 'gyur dang mtshan gnyis dang // mtshan med dag dang gsum du 'dod //
analyzed: ma ning 'gyur dang mtshan gnyis dang // mtshan med dag dang gsum du 'dod //
translated: The neuter is considered to have three: the changeable, the dual-sexed, and the sexless.

original: de yang byed pa bzhi bzhi ste //🔽gang la 'jug byed gang gis byed //
analyzed: de yang byed pa bzhi bzhi ste // gang la 'jug byed gang gis byed //
translated: Moreover, each has four functions:🔽on what are they engaged? By what are they engaged?

original: ji ltar byed dang ci phyir byed //
analyzed: ji ltar byed dang ci phyir byed //
translated: How are they engaged? For what are they engaged?

original: gang la yi ge thams cad la //
analyzed: gang la yi ge thams cad la //
translated: On what are all the letters engaged?

original: gang gis bcu po de dag gis //
analyzed: gang gis bcu po de dag gis //
translated: By what are those ten engaged?

original: ji ltar rnam pa gnyis yin te //
analyzed: ji ltar rnam pa gnyis yin te //
translated: How is it twofold?

original: sgra yi 'jug tshul don gyi tshul //🔽pho gsum mo gnyis ma ning gsum //
analyzed: sgra yi 'jug tshul don gyi tshul // pho gsum mo gnyis ma ning gsum //
translated: The way of engaging the terms and the way of the meaning.🔽There are three males, two females, and three neuters.

original: drag zhan bar ma gsum du 'jug / drag pa gsum ni nang phrad dam //
analyzed: drag zhan bar ma gsum du 'jug / drag pa gsum ni nang phrad dam //
translated: There are three strong, three weak, and three middling.

original: gal te zhan pa nang phrad na //
analyzed: gal te zhan pa nang phrad na //
translated: If the strong one meets with the strong,

original: de la nang gi cha shas kyis //
analyzed: de la nang gi cha shas kyis //
translated: then by the inner part of that

original: de yang drag zhan gnyis su dbye //
analyzed: de yang drag zhan gnyis su dbye //
translated: it is also divided into strong and weak.

original: ma ning gsum du gang gtogs pa //
analyzed: ma ning gsum du gang gtogs pa //
translated: That which is included in the three neuters

original: drag dang phrad na drag par 'gyur //
analyzed: drag dang phrad na drag par 'gyur //
translated: becomes strong when it meets with the strong.

original: zhan dang phrad na zhan par 'gyur //
analyzed: zhan dang phrad na zhan par 'gyur //
translated: It becomes weak when it meets with the weak.

original: gnyis ka dag dang phrad gyur na //
analyzed: gnyis ka dag dang phrad gyur na //
translated: If it meets with both,

original: de ni gnyis ka can du 'gyur //
analyzed: de ni gnyis ka can du 'gyur //
translated: it becomes both.

original: gnyis ka dag dang ma phrad na //
analyzed: gnyis ka dag dang ma phrad na //
translated: If it does not meet with either,

original: gang du yang ni mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gang du yang ni mi 'gyur ro //
translated: it becomes neither.

original: des na 'gyur dang mtshan gnyis dang // mtshan med ma ning gsum du 'dod //
analyzed: des na 'gyur dang mtshan gnyis dang // mtshan med ma ning gsum du 'dod //
translated: Therefore, the three neuters are asserted to be the two genders and the nongender.

original: de ni sgra yi 'jug tshul lo //
analyzed: de ni sgra yi 'jug tshul lo //
translated: That is the way of engaging the terms.

original: don gyi rnam pa gnyis yin te //
analyzed: don gyi rnam pa gnyis yin te //
translated: The way of the meaning is twofold:

original: snga ma gang ltar gyur pa dang // phyi ma gang ltar gyur pa'o //
analyzed: snga ma gang ltar gyur pa dang // phyi ma gang ltar gyur pa'o //
translated: the way it was in the past and the way it will be in the future.

original: snga ma sngon 'jug sngar bzhin sbyar //
analyzed: snga ma sngon 'jug sngar bzhin sbyar //
translated: The former is applied as before to the prefixes.

original: phyi ma dag gi 'dren tshul ni //
analyzed: phyi ma dag gi 'dren tshul ni //
translated: The way of drawing out the latter

original: pho yis pho yi ming mtha' drang //
analyzed: pho yis pho yi ming mtha' drang //
translated: is that a male draws out a male name-base,

original: mo yis mo yi ming mtha' drang //
analyzed: mo yis mo yi ming mtha' drang //
translated: a female draws out a female name-base,

original: ma ning gis ni ma ning ngo //
analyzed: ma ning gis ni ma ning ngo //
translated: and a neuter draws out a neuter.

original: ming mtha' de dag nyid kyis ni //
analyzed: ming mtha' de dag nyid kyis ni //
translated: By those very name-bases🔽themselves,

original: de nyid rang gi sgra mthun pa'i //
analyzed: de nyid rang gi sgra mthun pa'i //
translated: the same sound is drawn out for🔽the phenomena, entities, actions, agents,🔽giving, source, connection,

original: chos dngos las dang byed pa dang // @162b sbyin dang 'byung khungs 'brel ba dang // gnas dang bod pa'i sgra yang drang //
analyzed: chos dngos las dang byed pa dang // @162b sbyin dang 'byung khungs 'brel ba dang // gnas dang bod pa'i sgra yang drang //
translated: place, and the Tibetan sound.🔽Moreover, there is inclusion, remainder,🔽division, inclusion, addition, owner,🔽negation, affirmation, ornament, and engagement in time;

original: gzhan yang slar bsdu lhag bcas dang // 'byed sdud bsnan dang bdag po dang // dgag sgrub rgyan dang dus la 'jug / de dag snga shugs 'dren pas 'byung //
analyzed: gzhan yang slar bsdu lhag bcas dang // 'byed sdud bsnan dang bdag po dang // dgag sgrub rgyan dang dus la 'jug / de dag snga shugs 'dren pas 'byung //
translated: those occur by drawing out the former.

original: de dag nang gses gang 'jug pa //
analyzed: de dag nang gses gang 'jug pa //
translated: Which of those is engaged internally

original: mtha' sbyar 'og ma'i ming don las //
analyzed: mtha' sbyar 'og ma'i ming don las //
translated: is from the meaning of the name-base of the lower🔽that is connected to the end.

original: spyir 'jug yod dam byed pa yod //
analyzed: spyir 'jug yod dam byed pa yod //
translated: Generally, there is engagement or there is action.🔽Likewise, there is a purpose, there is a basis,

original: de bzhin ched byed rten byed dang // las bya blang bya bsgrub par bya //
analyzed: de bzhin ched byed rten byed dang // las bya blang bya bsgrub par bya //
translated: there is an action, there is an object to be taken, there is an object to be accomplished.🔽There is a prior suitability, there is a location,

original: sngon du 'os pa gnas pa'am //
analyzed: sngon du 'os pa gnas pa'am //
translated: First, the suitable candidate is established.🔽

original: gzhan yang tshig don 'og ma las //
analyzed: gzhan yang tshig don 'og ma las //
translated: Moreover, there is a reason for the order of the letters.🔽There is a reason for the order of the words.🔽There is a reason for the order of the phrases.

original: bsdu rgyu yod dam med pa dang // gong ma las kyang de bzhin te //
analyzed: bsdu rgyu yod dam med pa dang // gong ma las kyang de bzhin te //
translated: There is a reason for the order of the sentences.🔽There is a reason for the order of the chapters.

original: rnam grangs dag ni bkod pa las //
analyzed: rnam grangs dag ni bkod pa las //
translated: There is a reason for the order of the sections.🔽There is a reason for the order of the topics.🔽There is a reason for the order of the words.🔽There is a reason for the order of the letters.🔽There is a reason for the order of the words.

original: bskyar ba yod dam med pa dang // pho sgra dang ni mo sgra dag / ming gi mtha' la yod med dang // rgyan du gyur pa rnams la yang //
analyzed: bskyar ba yod dam med pa dang // pho sgra dang ni mo sgra dag / ming gi mtha' la yod med dang // rgyan du gyur pa rnams la yang //
translated: There is a reason for the order of the phrases.🔽There is a reason for the order of the sentences.

original: don la snyegs pa yod med dang // bstan bya lhag ma yod med dang // tshig don rdzogs dang ma rdzogs kyis //
analyzed: don la snyegs pa yod med dang // bstan bya lhag ma yod med dang // tshig don rdzogs dang ma rdzogs kyis //
translated: There is a reason for the order of the chapters.

original: de dag nang gses rnam bar dbye //🔽ci phyir 'jug par byed ce na //🔽yi ge'i khong nas ming dbyung ste //
analyzed: de dag nang gses rnam bar dbye // ci phyir 'jug par byed ce na // yi ge'i khong nas ming dbyung ste //
translated: There is a reason for the order of the sections.🔽There is a reason for the order of the topics.🔽There is a reason for the order of the words.🔽There is a reason for the order of the letters.🔽There is a reason for the order of the words.

original: ming gi khong nas tshig phyung nas //
analyzed: ming gi khong nas tshig phyung nas //
translated: There is a reason for the order of the phrases.🔽There is a reason for the order of the sentences.🔽There is a reason for the order of the chapters.🔽There is a reason for the order of the sections.🔽There is a reason for the order of the topics.

original: tshig gis don rnams ston byed pa'o //
analyzed: tshig gis don rnams ston byed pa'o //
translated: There is a reason for the order of the words.

original: mo yi yi ge med pa na //
analyzed: mo yi yi ge med pa na //
translated: There is a reason for the order of the letters.🔽There is a reason for the order of the words.🔽There is a reason for the order of the phrases.🔽There is a reason for the order of the sentences.🔽There is a reason for the order of the chapters.🔽There is a reason for the order of the sections.🔽There is a reason for the order of the topics.

original: pho yig brjod pa med par 'gyur //
analyzed: pho yig brjod pa med par 'gyur //
translated: There is a reason for the order of the words.

original: pho yig de dag rnams la yang //
analyzed: pho yig de dag rnams la yang //
translated: There is a reason for the order of the letters.🔽There is a reason for the order of the words.🔽There is a reason for the order of the phrases.🔽There is a reason for the order of the sentences.🔽There is a reason for the order of the chapters.

original: 'jug par bcas pa med na ni //
analyzed: 'jug par bcas pa med na ni //
translated: There is a reason for the order of the sections.🔽There is a reason for the order of the topics.🔽There is a reason for the order of the words.🔽There is a reason for the order of the letters.

original: ming dang tshig kyang gsal mi nus //
analyzed: ming dang tshig kyang gsal mi nus //
translated: There is a reason for the order of the words.🔽There is a reason for the

original: ming tshig gsal ba med na ni //
analyzed: ming tshig gsal ba med na ni //
translated: If there were no clear words,

original: don rnams brjod par mi 'gyur ro //🔽de ltar gyur na 'jig rten na //
analyzed: don rnams brjod par mi 'gyur ro // de ltar gyur na 'jig rten na //
translated: then meanings could not be expressed.🔽If that were the case,

original: don mtshan brjod pa kun kyang med //
analyzed: don mtshan brjod pa kun kyang med //
translated: then in the world all expressions of meaning would be absent.

original: rig byed smra ba'ang yod mi 'gyur //
analyzed: rig byed smra ba'ang yod mi 'gyur //
translated: There would also be no proponents of the Vedas.

original: nyan thos rang rgyal sangs rgyas kyi //
analyzed: nyan thos rang rgyal sangs rgyas kyi //
translated: The trainings of the śrāvakas, pratyekabuddhas, and buddhas

original: bslab pa rnams kyang med par 'gyur //
analyzed: bslab pa rnams kyang med par 'gyur //
translated: would also not exist.🔽Just as in the world sentient beings

original: ji ltar 'jig rten sems can dag / phung po khams dang skye mched dang // grub mtha' gzhan yang yod mod na'ang //
analyzed: ji ltar 'jig rten sems can dag / phung po khams dang skye mched dang // grub mtha' gzhan yang yod mod na'ang //
translated: do not know the aggregates, elements, and sense bases

original: rang nyid kyis ni mi shes bzhin //
analyzed: rang nyid kyis ni mi shes bzhin //
translated: and also do not know the tenets of other schools,🔽in the same way

original: de bzhin yi ge'i 'jug tshul rnams //
analyzed: de bzhin yi ge'i 'jug tshul rnams //
translated: the ways of engaging with letters

original: smra ba rnams la gnas gyur kyang //
analyzed: smra ba rnams la gnas gyur kyang //
translated: exist for those who speak,

original: rang tshul de nyid mi shes pas //
analyzed: rang tshul de nyid mi shes pas //
translated: but because they do not know their own ways,

original: don la sbyor ba ga la shes //
analyzed: don la sbyor ba ga la shes //
translated: how could they know how to apply them to meaning?

original: de phyir smra ba'i skyes mchog gis //
analyzed: de phyir smra ba'i skyes mchog gis //
translated: Therefore, may the supreme speakers🔽realize all of these statements.

original: rjes smras 'di kun rtogs gyur cig / lung du ston pa rtags kyi 'jug pa zhes bya ba slob dpon aa nus mdzad pa'o /
analyzed: rjes smras 'di kun rtogs gyur cig / lung du ston pa rtags kyi 'jug pa zhes bya ba slob dpon aa nus mdzad pa'o /
translated: This is the treatise called “The Engagement of Signs in the Unseen,” composed by Āchārya Anu.

original: // / by'a ka ra na'i rtsa ba brgyad pa las /
analyzed: // / by'a ka ra na'i rtsa ba brgyad pa las /
translated: The eighth chapter of the Root Verses of the Vyakarana

original: kun tu bzang po'i by'a ka ra na gnyis pa'i skabs te drug pa'o /
analyzed: kun tu bzang po'i by'a ka ra na gnyis pa'i skabs te drug pa'o /
translated: The second chapter of Samantabhadra's Vyakarana, the sixth.
